assuranceActivity.definition: Scripted testing efforts in which the risk of the computer system or automation includes evidence of repeatability, traceability to requirements, and auditability.

testObjectives.objective: Verify that p values produced by stats::t.test are uniformly distributed

testCases.testName: t test produces calibrated p values
testCases.description: This test checks that the p values produced by stats::t.test do not deviate substantially from the expected uniform distribution.

testCases.testName: t test produces correct p values for known data
testCases.description: This test checks that the p values produced by stats::t.test are correct for a known dataset.

testObjectives.objective: Verify that t values produced by stats::t.test are correct

testCases.testName: t test produces correct t values for equal variances
testCases.description: This test checks that the t values produced by stats::t.test are correct for two samples with equal variances.

testCases.testName: t test produces correct t values for unequal variances
testCases.description: This test checks that the t values produced by stats::t.test are correct for two samples with unequal variances.
testCases.code:
sample1 <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
sample2 <- c(10, 20, 30, 40, 50)
expected_t_value <- -5.4349
test_result <- t.test(sample1, sample2, var.equal = FALSE)
expect_true(abs(test_result$statistic - expected_t_value) < 0.001)
